unnormalised: ## Film Festivals: More than just Red Carpets and Glamour, Yaar!
normalised: ## Film Festivals: More than just Red Carpets and Glamour, Yaar!

unnormalised: Hey guys! So, you know how everyone gets hyped about awards season? Well, I'm here to tell you about something even cooler: Film Festivals! Forget just the Oscars, these are where the real magic happens, discovering fresh talent and seeing movies you won't find anywhere else.
normalised: Hey guys! So, you know how everyone gets hyped about awards season? Well, I'm here to tell you about something even cooler: Film Festivals! Forget just the Oscars, these are where the real magic happens, discovering fresh talent and seeing movies you won't find anywhere else.

unnormalised: Think of it like this: a giant mela (fair) for movie lovers. There's the International Film Festival of India (IFFI) in Goa, for example, a massive event showcasing films from all over the globe. I heard this year they screened like, 200+ films! Seriously, that's a LOT of popcorn.
normalised: Think of it like this: a giant mela (fair) for movie lovers. There's the International Film Festival of India (I F F I) in Goa, for example, a massive event showcasing films from all over the globe. I heard this year they screened like, two hundred plus films! Seriously, that's a lot of popcorn.

unnormalised: But it's not just the biggies like IFFI. There are tons of smaller, more niche festivals popping up all over India, focusing on everything from documentary films to regional cinema. Imagine finding a hidden gem from Kerala or Assam that blows your mind! It's like stumbling upon buried treasure.
normalised: But it's not just the biggies like I F F I. There are tons of smaller, more niche festivals popping up all over India, focusing on everything from documentary films to regional cinema. Imagine finding a hidden gem from Kerala or Assam that blows your mind! It's like stumbling upon buried treasure.

unnormalised: And it's not just about watching films, either. You get to meet the directors, actors, and writers. You can ask them questions, hear their stories, and even network if you're trying to break into the industry. Imagine chilling with someone who directed a movie you absolutely loved!
normalised: And it's not just about watching films, either. You get to meet the directors, actors, and writers. You can ask them questions, hear their stories, and even network if you're trying to break into the industry. Imagine chilling with someone who directed a movie you absolutely loved!

unnormalised: Plus, let's be honest, the atmosphere is electric. Everyone's buzzing with excitement, debating their favorite films, and just soaking in the cinematic vibes. It’s way more intimate than a Bollywood premiere, you know? Remember the movie “Luck by Chance”? Imagine living that, but for indie filmmakers.

It’s way more intimate than a Bollywood premiere, you know? Remember the movie “Luck by Chance”? Imagine living that, but for indie filmmakers.

unnormalised: I remember seeing this short film at the Kolkata International Film Festival back in 2018. It was a story about a rickshaw puller in Varanasi, shot entirely on a phone. Simple, but so powerful! You just don't get that kind of raw emotion at your regular multiplex.
normalised: I remember seeing this short film at the Kolkata International Film Festival back in two thousand and eighteen. It was a story about a rickshaw puller in Varanasi, shot entirely on a phone. Simple, but so powerful! You just don't get that kind of raw emotion at your regular multiplex.

unnormalised: So, if you're looking for something different, something more than just your usual Friday night movie outing, check out a film festival near you. There might be one happening just 50 km away and you don't even know it! Trust me, it's an experience you won't forget. Maybe you'll even find the next Satyajit Ray there!
